cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 470 mi ESE of Key West, FL and 165 mi E of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest along or just north of Cuba, forecast to turn northwest over the Straits of Florida Saturday, then track north toward the eastern Gulf of Mexico and the Florida Panhandle before curving inland across the Southeast U.S.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch from Ocean Reef FL westward through the Florida Keys to Dry Tortugas and along the southwest Florida coast to Bonita Beach; several central Cuban provinces under watch
weather_observation.impacted_coast: northern coast of Cuba, the Bahamas, Florida Keys, Florida Peninsula and Panhandle, northern Gulf Coast (AL–FL), and eventually inland Southeast U.S.
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (forecast totals generally below 4 inches for northern Ohio)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No (port is on Lake Erie, not the ocean)
weather_observation.wind: Remnant system could bring occasional gusts 20–30 mph to Lake Erie region mid-week
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to locally heavy rain (1–3 in) possible as remnants pass nearby mid-week, which could create ponding and minor drainage issues at the terminal
weather_observation.other_hazards: Reduced visibility, lightning, and short-term scheduling/berthing disruptions from rain bands
